column4: I am using TorProject (Vidala + Tor Button) to hide my ip online. With firefox it works great. Now I have a script (parsing google Scholar) and I want to change the ip for every request I do, so I stay hidden from big brother. How is this managable? If vidala is on, does this mean, that anything, that I do with ma computer runs through the Tor network or only the things I make with firefox?
have you got it working with xchat?
trying to work on that now
Nope, I didn't. I don't use xchat.
I just want my python script to run through the tor network
well, tor needs to be configured to work with whatever you're doing  just like Firefox, or xchat for that matter..    you're not hidden just because you have it running
maybe you already know that
Yes, but I don't know how to configure tor, so that it works with my terminal... You got a hint for me?
no sorry,  i asked a similar question yesterday but it's all a bit beyond me right now
Thank you anyway and good look for your own problem. =)
Did you see that? http://bit.ly/caargk XChat is listed below...
no I haven't..  i just followed the steps at the project site  since the other isn't kept up to date (as they say)  https://www.torproject.org/docs/debian
i'll try it though, thanks!
yw
this is what I get trying that method   http://paste.ubuntu.com/530050/
Sorry, but not into this stuff, either. I just passed the link to you, because I remembered, that you are looking for sth. that has to do with TOR and Xchat. :)
yea i'm aware...  just weird the lack of documentation on xchat/tor usage   since both are pretty popular
/j  #tor
at this point it's not really an ubuntu specific issue
wish i knew..   also keep in mind you really don't need what you're asking for, unless you're doing something illegal or are just paranoid

It is for science. :-) Nothing illegal. I just want to avoid the bans, and to automate my script, so I don't have to stick to my computer, while it is running. The results will be published in a paper next January. :)
try #linux   they seem a little more receptive of this stuff there
and it's not dead
Thanks
